page.title: 09Our visit to Sherford, 1985.
page.content: We visited Sherford as part of our project work. First we visited the church where the Reverend Ticquet showed us round. It is a very old church but still nice inside. There are two little stair cases there, we went up them and it was very dark. When we had looked all around the church we went to the village to do some sketching. Sherford is tucked away behind Frogmore. There are old and new houses in Sherford, there are council houses too. We all chose a house to sketch. Some people drew thatched cottages and some drew tiled houses. There are four farms in Sherford, one of which belongs to Mrs. Perkins. She showed us some of the interesting things to see there. Sherford is mostly surrounded by crops. We all thought that it was a very pleasant and peaceful place.
